Class MonthCalendar

java.lang.Object
MonthCalendar
public class MonthCalendar extends Object
The MonthCalendar class represents a monthly calendar that manages events for a specific year and month. It keeps track of scheduled (uncompleted) events and completed events for the month.

This class supports:
- Storing events for each day of the month
- Tracking completed events separately
- Handling invalid inputs and exceptional circumstances

Instance fields are properly initialized to ensure a valid state upon object creation.

  • Field Details

    • MONTH

      private final YearMonth MONTH
      The year and month represented by this calendar in the format YYYY-MM.

    • daysCount

      private int daysCount
      The number of days in the specified month.

    • events

      private ArrayList<Event>[] events
      An array of lists where each index represents a day of the month, and each list stores the scheduled (uncompleted) events for that day. The size of the array corresponds to the number of days in the month.

    • completedEvents

      private ArrayList<Event> completedEvents
      A list that stores all completed events for this month.

  • Constructor Details

    • MonthCalendar

      public MonthCalendar(int year, int month) throws DateTimeException
      Constructs a MonthCalendar object for the specified year and month and initializes ALL instance fields.

      The YearMonth.of(int, int) method is used to initialize the month. If either the year or month is invalid, a DateTimeException is thrown.

      The YearMonth.lengthOfMonth() method is used to determine the number of days in the month.

      Initialization details:
      - The events array is created with a length equal to the number of days in the month.
      - The events[i] represents the list of events on day i+1
      - Each list of events each day is initialized to a new empty ArrayList<Event>.
      - The completedEvents list is initialized as an empty ArrayList<Event>.

      Parameters:
      year - The year in YYYY format.
      month - The month represented as an integer (1 for January, 12 for December).
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the year or month values are invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getMonthName

      public String getMonthName()
      Returns the textual representation of the month in full style format, such as 'February'
      Returns:
      the text value of the month in full text style length

    • getMonthNumber

      public int getMonthNumber()
      Gets the month-of-year field as on int from 1 to 12 of this MonthCalendar.
      Returns:
      the month as an int from 1 to 12.

    • getDaysCount

      public int getDaysCount()
      Gets the number of days in the current month calendar
      Returns:
      the number of days in the current calendar

    • addEvent

      public boolean addEvent(int day, String description, int startHour, int startMin)
      Adds an event to the specified day's list of events in the correct position, maintaining ascending order based on the Event.compareTo(Event) method.

      If two events are equal according to `Event.compareTo()`, the newly (most recently) added event will be placed after the existing ones, preserving insertion order.

      Parameters:
      day - The day of the month (1 - number of days in the month).
      description - A brief text description of the event (not null and not blank).
      startHour - The hour the event starts (0-23, 24-hour format). Example: 6 PM → 18, Midnight → 0.
      startMin - The minute the event starts (**0-59**).
      Returns:
      true if the event is successfully added, otherwise false if:
      - The day is out of range ( ≤ 0 or > number of days in the month ).
      - An IllegalArgumentException is thrown while creating the event (invalid inputs).
      - An equivalent event (same description, day, and start time) already exists in the calendar.

    • cancelEvent

      public void cancelEvent(String description, int day, int startHour, int startMin)
      Cancels (removes) an event from the specified day if a matching event exists. A matching event is identified by its description, start hour, and start minute.

      Two events match based on the Event.equals() method.

      Validation Rules:
      - description must not be null or blank.
      - day must be between 1 and the number of days in the month (inclusive).
      - startHour must be between 0-23 (24-hour format).
      - startMin must be between 0-59.

      Parameters:
      description - The description of the event to be canceled.
      day - The specific day of the month (1 - number of days in the month).
      startHour - The start hour of the event (0-23, 24-hour format).
      startMin - The start minute of the event (0-59).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If:
      - description is null or blank.
      - day is ≤ 0 or > number of days in the month.
      - startHour is out of range (0-23).
      - startMin is out of range (0-59).
      NoSuchElementException - with a descriptive error message if no event with the matching description, startHour, and startMin is found on the given day.

    • markEventAsComplete

      public void markEventAsComplete(Event e)
      Marks the event matching the specific input argument event e as complete if a match is found in the list of events. Removes the matching event from the list of the events scheduled on the event e's day, and add it to index 0 of the list of completed events.
      Parameters:
      e - a specific event scheduled at a valid day of the month
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with a descriptive error message if e is null or if e is scheduled for a non-valid day of the month (e.getDay() ≤ 0 OR e.getDay() > number of days in the month)
      NoSuchElementException - with a descriptive error message if no matching event with e is found in the list of events

    • getEvents

      public ArrayList<Event>[] getEvents()
      Returns a deep copy of the array of events in this MonthCalendar.

      The deep copy of events stores deep copies of the list of events at each day and does not expose the original references of the lists.

      This method does NOT use Arrays.copyOf() to return a copy of the events array.

      This method does NOT make a deep copy of the stored events at each day.

      Returns:
      a deep copy of the list of uncompleted events scheduled for this MonthCalendar

    • getCompletedEvents

      public ArrayList<Event> getCompletedEvents()
      Returns a deep copy of the completed events ArrayList of this MonthCalendar

      This method makes a deep copy of each completed event.

      Returns:
      a deep copy of the list of completed events scheduled for this MonthCalendar

    • clearAllCompletedEvents

      public void clearAllCompletedEvents()
      Clears all completed events stored in the completedEvents ArrayList.

    • getCompletedEventsAsString

      public String getCompletedEventsAsString()
      Provided method -- Returns a String representation of all completed events
      Returns:
      a String containing all completed events with their completed days on separate lines, and an empty string if the list of completed events is empty.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provided method -- Returns a String representation of all uncompleted events.
      Events scheduled on the same day must be in the increasing order.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String representation of All the events stored in the events list, and an empty string if the list of events is empty.
